vectorData.altText: 13. The auditory association area, where sounds encoding language are recognized, is located in the ________________ lobe, specifically in the posterior one-third of the ___________ __________ gyrus. (3 words total; separate answers with one space)
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
That’s right!  Auditory association area, aka Wernicke’s area, is located in the posterior 1/3 of the superior temporal gyrus of the temporal lobe.
Identify the major gyri of the cerebral hemisphere.

Precentral gyrus: parallel and anterior to the central sulcus. This is primary motor cortex.
Superior, middle and inferior frontal gyri: run roughly horizontally from the frontal pole to the
precentral gyrus. Within the inferior frontal gyrus, identify the opercular and triangular portions, which are the location of Broca's area, the motor speech area.

Superior, middle, inferior temporal gyri run roughly parallel to the lateral fissure, along the length of the temporal lobe. The posterior one third of the superior temporal gyrus in the dominant hemisphere forms Wernicke's (auditory association) area where sounds encoding language are recognized.
Superolateral view of the right cerebral hemisphere. From Serial Dissections of the Human Brainby Carlton G. Smith, M.D., Ph.D.
